title: ForgeRock Common Audit for CEF
descriptionMarkdown: The ForgeRock Identity Platform provides a single common auditing framework. Extract and aggregate log data across the entire platform with common audit (CAUD) event handlers and unique IDs so that it can be tracked holistically. Open and extensible, you can leverage audit logging and reporting capabilities for integration with Microsoft Azure Sentinel via this CAUD for CEF connector.

graphQueries.baseQuery: CommonSecurityLog | where DeviceVendor in ("ForgeRock Inc") | where DeviceProduct in ("Trust Partner Network")

sampleQueries.description: Total failed login attempts to the ForgeRock Platform
sampleQueries.query:
CommonSecurityLog | where DeviceVendor in ("ForgeRock Inc") | where DeviceProduct in ("Trust Partner Network")
| extend user = split(split(AdditionalExtensions, ";", 4)[0], "=", 1)[0] // extract userID from  4th field in json payload
| where strlen(user) > 2 // if not null
| where DeviceAction =~ "FAILED"

CommonSecurityLog | where DeviceVendor in ("ForgeRock Inc") | where DeviceProduct in ("Trust Partner Network")
| where DeviceAction =~ "FAILED"
| project SourceIP 
| evaluate autocluster(0.6)

dataTypes.name: CommonSecurityLog (ForgeRock)
dataTypes.lastDataReceivedQuery:
CommonSecurityLog | where DeviceVendor in ("ForgeRock Inc") | where DeviceProduct == "Trust Partner Network"
| summarize Time = max(TimeGenerated)
| where isnotempty(Time)

value:
CommonSecurityLog | where DeviceVendor in ("ForgeRock Inc") | where DeviceProduct == "Trust Partner Network"
| summarize LastLogReceived = max(TimeGenerated)
            | project IsConnected = LastLogReceived > ago(30d)

resourceProvider.permissionsDisplayText: read and write permissions are required.

instructionSteps.title: Configuration for the ForgeRock Common Audit (CAUD) for Microsoft Azure Sentinel
instructionSteps.description: In ForgeRock, install and configure this Common Audit (CAUD) for Azure Sentinel per the documentation at https://github.com/javaservlets/SentinelAuditEventHandler. Next, in Azure, follow the below CEF steps.

instructionSteps.title: 1. Linux Syslog agent configuration
instructionSteps.description:
Install and configure the Linux agent to collect your Common Event Format (CEF) Syslog messages and forward them to Azure Sentinel.

> Notice that the data from all regions will be stored in the selected workspace

innerSteps.title: 1.1 Select or create a Linux machine
innerSteps.description: Select or create a Linux machine that Azure Sentinel will use as the proxy between your security solution and Azure Sentinel this machine can be on your on-prem environment, Azure or other clouds.

innerSteps.title: 1.2 Install the CEF collector on the Linux machine
innerSteps.description:
Install the Microsoft Monitoring Agent on your Linux machine and configure the machine to listen on the necessary port and forward messages to your Azure Sentinel workspace. The CEF collector collects CEF messages on port 514 TCP.

> 1. Make sure that you have Python on your machine using the following command: python -version.

> 2. You must have elevated permissions (sudo) on your machine.

instructionSteps.title: 2. Forward Common Event Format (CEF) logs to Syslog agent
instructionSteps.description: Set your security solution to send Syslog messages in CEF format to the proxy machine. Make sure you to send the logs to port 514 TCP on the machine's IP address.
